intro: Oxybasis × schulzeana, commonly known as the hybrid grass or Schultze's oatgrass, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Oxybasis × schulzeana is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its botanical features make it an important component of native plant communities in its range.
